name.description: The name of the ExpressRoute circuit. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

resource_group_name.description: The name of the resource group in which to create the ExpressRoute circuit. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

location.description: Specifies the supported Azure location where the resource exists. Changing this forces a new resource to be created.

service_provider_name.description: The name of the ExpressRoute Service Provider.

peering_location.description: The name of the peering location and **not** the Azure resource location.

bandwidth_in_mbps.description: The bandwidth in Mbps of the circuit being created.

sku.description: A `sku` block for the ExpressRoute circuit as documented below.

allow_classic_operations.description: Allow the circuit to interact with classic (RDFE

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

tier.description: The service tier. Possible values are `Basic`, `Local`, `Standard` or `Premium`.

family.description: The billing mode for bandwidth. Possible values are `MeteredData` or `UnlimitedData`.

id.description: The Resource ID of the ExpressRoute circuit.

service_provider_provisioning_state.description: The ExpressRoute circuit provisioning state from your chosen service provider. Possible values are "NotProvisioned", "Provisioning", "Provisioned", and "Deprovisioning".

service_key.description: The string needed by the service provider to provision the ExpressRoute circuit.

create.description: Used when creating the ExpressRoute Circuit.

update.description: Used when updating the ExpressRoute Circuit.

read.description: Used when retrieving the ExpressRoute Circuit.

delete.description: Used when deleting the ExpressRoute Circuit.
